page.title: 01Area 04080411
page.content: The area covered by the twelve squares 04080411 is basically rural, but includes some industry. Nearly a whole square is covered by the reservoir at Blackmoorfoot: at present it is having its treatment plant extended and modernised. Most of the remaining land is rough grazing. About two, half squares, consist of deciduous woodland, through which are some very pleasant walks.The farms in the area are given over to dairy produce although one produces beef. The area also contains a number of disused quarries which once provided much local building stone. These squares contain some unusual industries such as a vinery for blending wine, a company that makes automatic control system for poultry farmers and a scrapyard which looks very strange set against moorland.
